intro: Ayenia catalpifolia, commonly known as the Catalpa leaf ayenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in woodland areas. Ayenia catalpifolia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and ability to support local wildlife.
